column2: Then she regained her native element; water covered her gills, and she could begin to swim.
column3: Then she regained her native element; water covered her gills, and she could begin to swim.

column2: II: IN THE SHELTER OF THE CREEK
column3: two: IN THE SHELTER OF THE CREEK

column2: Grim was a year old when her scales began to grow.
column3: Grim was a year old when her scales began to grow.

column2: In her early youth, when she could only eat small creatures, she had lived exclusively upon water-insects and larvae; but from now onwards she had no respect for any flesh but that which clothed her own ribs.
column3: In her early youth, when she could only eat small creatures, she had lived exclusively upon water insects and larvae; but from now onwards she had no respect for any flesh but that which clothed her own ribs.

column2: She attacked any fish that was not big enough to swallow _her_, and devoured bleak and small roach with peculiar satisfaction.
column3: She attacked any fish that was not big enough to swallow underscore her underscore, and devoured bleak and small roach with peculiar satisfaction.

column2: Now she took her revenge on the voracious small fry that had offended her when she was still in an embryo state.
column3: Now she took her revenge on the voracious small fry that had offended her when she was still in an embryo state.

column2: She had not been hatched artificially, or come into the world in a wooden box with running water passing through it.
column3: She had not been hatched artificially, or come into the world in a wooden box with running water passing through it.

column2: No, the whole thing had taken place in the most natural manner.
column3: No, the whole thing had taken place in the most natural manner.

column2: In the flickering sunshine of a March day, her mother, surrounded by three equally ardent wooers, had spawned, and the eggs had dropped and attached themselves to some tufts of grass at the edge of the lake.
column3: In the flickering sunshine of a March day, her mother, surrounded by three equally ardent wooers, had spawned, and the eggs had dropped and attached themselves to some tufts of grass at the edge of the lake.

column2: The very next day, however, little fish had begun to gather about those tufts; one day more, and there were swarms of them.
column3: The very next day, however, little fish had begun to gather about those tufts; one day more, and there were swarms of them.

column2: Eagerly they searched the tufts and devoured all the eggs they could find; and so thoroughly did they go about their business, that of the thousands upon thousands of the mother's eggs, only two that had fallen into the heart of a grass-stalk were left.
column3: Eagerly they searched the tufts and devoured all the eggs they could find; and so thoroughly did they go about their business, that of the thousands upon thousands of the mother's eggs, only two that had fallen into the heart of a grass stalk were left.

column2: Out of one of these Grim had come.
column3: Out of one of these Grim had come.

column2: The sun had looked after her, hatched her out, and taught her to seize whatever came in her way.
column3: The sun had looked after her, hatched her out, and taught her to seize whatever came in her way.

column2: Now she was avenging the injuries to her tribe.
column3: Now she was avenging the injuries to her tribe.

column2: She possessed a remarkable power of placing herself, and knew how to choose her position so as to disappear, as it were, in the water.
column3: She possessed a remarkable power of placing herself, and knew how to choose her position so as to disappear, as it were, in the water.

column2: The stalks of the reeds threw their shadows across her body in all directions; water-grass and drifting duck-weed veiled her; the silly roach and other restless little fish flitted about her, sometimes so close to her mouth that she could feel the waves made by their tail-fins.
column3: The stalks of the reeds threw their shadows across her body in all directions; water grass and drifting duck weed veiled her; the silly roach and other restless little fish flitted about her, sometimes so close to her mouth that she could feel the waves made by their tail fins.

column2: Some would almost run right into her; but when they saw her, then how the water flashed with starry gleams, and how quickly they all made off!
column3: Some would almost run right into her; but when they saw her, then how the water flashed with starry gleams, and how quickly they all made off!

column2: She liked best to hide where the water-lilies floated in islands of green, for there the treacherous shadows--her best friends--fell clearly through the water; absorbed her, as it were, and made capture easy for her.
column3: She liked best to hide where the water lilies floated in islands of green, for there the treacherous shadows-her best friends-fell clearly through the water; absorbed her, as it were, and made capture easy for her.

column2: If she found herself discovered, she would retreat with as little haste as possible; for that sort of thing aroused too much attention, and created widespread disturbance in the fishy world.
column3: If she found herself discovered, she would retreat with as little haste as possible; for that sort of thing aroused too much attention, and created widespread disturbance in the fishy world.

column2: If she lay on the surface, for instance, and suspected that she was being watched from above, she became, as it were, more and more indistinct and one with the dark water, letting herself sink imperceptibly, at the same time beginning to work all her fins.
column3: If she lay on the surface, for instance, and suspected that she was being watched from above, she became, as it were, more and more indistinct and one with the dark water, letting herself sink imperceptibly, at the same time beginning to work all her fins.

column2: In ample folds they softly crept round the long stick that her body now resembled, fringed and veiled it and bore it away.
column3: In ample folds they softly crept round the long stick that her body now resembled, fringed and veiled it and bore it away.

column2: And just as she knew how to place herself, so did she know how to move--cautiously and discreetly.
column3: And just as she knew how to place herself, so did she know how to move-cautiously and discreetly.

column2: Formerly she had measured only a finger's length, and now she was already about a foot long; her voraciousness had increased in a corresponding degree.
column3: Formerly she had measured only a finger's length, and now she was already about a foot long; her voraciousness had increased in a corresponding degree.

column2: She could eat every hour of the day.
column3: She could eat every hour of the day.

column2: She would fill herself right up to the neck, and even have half a fish sticking out beyond.
column3: She would fill herself right up to the neck, and even have half a fish sticking out beyond.

column2: It was quite a common sight to see a little flapping fish-tail for which her digestive organs had not room as yet, sticking out of her mouth like a lively tongue.
column3: It was quite a common sight to see a little flapping fish tail for which her digestive organs had not room as yet, sticking out of her mouth like a lively tongue.

column2: She would swim about delightedly, sucking it as a boy would suck a stick of candy.
column3: She would swim about delightedly, sucking it as a boy would suck a stick of candy.

column2: One day she was gliding slowly through a clump of rushes, as lifeless and dead as any stick.
column3: One day she was gliding slowly through a clump of rushes, as lifeless and dead as any stick.

column2: Her eyes seemed to be on stalks and spied eagerly round, but her body exhibited the least possible movement and eagerness.
column3: Her eyes seemed to be on stalks and spied eagerly round, but her body exhibited the least possible movement and eagerness.

column2: She turned, but even then holding herself stiff, and playing her new part of a drifting stick in a masterly manner.
column3: She turned, but even then holding herself stiff, and playing her new part of a drifting stick in a masterly manner.

column2: As she did so she discovered her brother, as promising a specimen of a young pike as herself, with all the distinguishing marks of the race.
column3: As she did so she discovered her brother, as promising a specimen of a young pike as herself, with all the distinguishing marks of the race.

column2: Although cold-blooded, she was of a fiery temperament, and as she was also hungry, she stared greedily and with cannibal feelings at the apparition.
column3: Although cold blooded, she was of a fiery temperament, and as she was also hungry, she stared greedily and with cannibal feelings at the apparition.

column2: Her appetite grew in immeasurable units of time.
column3: Her appetite grew in immeasurable units of time.

column2: The food was at hand, it stared her in the face; she forgot relationship and resemblance, and bending in the middle so that head and tail met, she seized her brother with a lightning movement.
column3: The food was at hand, it stared her in the face; she forgot relationship and resemblance, and bending in the middle so that head and tail met, she seized her brother with a lightning movement.

column2: He was quite as big as she, struggled until he was unable to move a fin; but the stroke was successful.
column3: He was quite as big as she, struggled until he was unable to move a fin; but the stroke was successful.

column2: She began to understand things, and grew ever fiercer and more violent and voracious.
column3: She began to understand things, and grew ever fiercer and more violent and voracious.

column2: Her teeth were doubled, and as they grew they were sharpened by the continual suction of the water through the gills.
column3: Her teeth were doubled, and as they grew they were sharpened by the continual suction of the water through the gills.

column2: It was as if she understood their value, too, for she would often take up her position on the bottom and stir up grains of fine, hard sand, thus improving the grinding process considerably.
column3: It was as if she understood their value, too, for she would often take up her position on the bottom and stir up grains of fine, hard sand, thus improving the grinding process considerably.

column2: It was mostly in the half-light that she now went hunting, in the early dawn or at dusk.
column3: It was mostly in the half light that she now went hunting, in the early dawn or at dusk.

column2: Her sharp eyes could see in the dark like those of the owl and the cat.
column3: Her sharp eyes could see in the dark like those of the owl and the cat.

column2: When the shadows lengthened, and the red glow from the sky spread over the water, she felt how favourable her surroundings were, and she became one with the power in her mighty nature.
column3: When the shadows lengthened, and the red glow from the sky spread over the water, she felt how favourable her surroundings were, and she became one with the power in her mighty nature.

column2: But in the daytime, she lay peacefully drowsing.
column3: But in the daytime, she lay peacefully drowsing.

column2: The creek in which she lived had low-lying banks.
column3: The creek in which she lived had low lying banks.

column2: Among the short, thick grass, orchids and marsh marigolds bloomed side by side, and the ragged robin unfolded its frayed, deep pink flowers upon a stiff, dark brown stalk, that always had a mass of frothy wetness about its head.
column3: Among the short, thick grass, orchids and marsh marigolds bloomed side by side, and the ragged robin unfolded its frayed, deep pink flowers upon a stiff, dark brown stalk, that always had a mass of frothy wetness about its head.

column2: Farther out, the muddy water and horsetails began, and beyond them the tall, waving reeds, which stretched away in great clumps as far as it was possible for them to reach the bottom.
column3: Farther out, the muddy water and horsetails began, and beyond them the tall, waving reeds, which stretched away in great clumps as far as it was possible for them to reach the bottom.

column2: Where _they_ left off, the round-stalked olive-green bog rushes began, wading farther and farther out, until in midstream they gathered in low clumps and groves, inhabited by an abundant insect life.
column3: Where underscore they underscore left off, the round stalked olive green bog rushes began, wading farther and farther out, until in midstream they gathered in low clumps and groves, inhabited by an abundant insect life.

column2: Beautiful butterflies danced their bridal dance out there, some bright yellow with black borders, others with the sunset glow upon their wings.
column3: Beautiful butterflies danced their bridal dance out there, some bright yellow with black borders, others with the sunset glow upon their wings.

column2: Dragon-flies and water-nymphs by the score refracted the sun's rays as they turned with a flash of all the colours of the rainbow. Black whirligigs lay in clusters and slept; and on the india rubber-like leaves of the water-lily, flies and wasps crawled about dry-shop, and refreshed themselves with the water.
column3: Dragon flies and water nymphs by the score refracted the sun's rays as they turned with a flash of all the colours of the rainbow. Black whirligigs lay in clusters and slept; and on the india rubber like leaves of the water lily, flies and wasps crawled about dry shop, and refreshed themselves with the water.

column2: In the still, early morning the reeds sigh and tremble.
column3: In the still, early morning the reeds sigh and tremble.

column2: The little yellowish grey sedge-warbler comes out suddenly from its hiding place, seizes the largest of the butterflies by the body, and as suddenly disappears again.
column3: The little yellowish grey sedge warbler comes out suddenly from its hiding place, seizes the largest of the butterflies by the body, and as suddenly disappears again.

column2: A little later it begins its soft little sawing song, which blends so well with the perpetual, monotonous whispering of the reeds.
column3: A little later it begins its soft little sawing song, which blends so well with the perpetual, monotonous whispering of the reeds.

column2: Grim, down among the vegetation, only faintly catches the subdued tones; she is occupied with an event that is developing with great rapidity.
column3: Grim, down among the vegetation, only faintly catches the subdued tones; she is occupied with an event that is developing with great rapidity.

column2: A moth has fallen suddenly into the clear water.
column3: A moth has fallen suddenly into the clear water.

column2: It tries to rise, but cannot, so darts rapidly across the surface of the water, dragging its tawny wings behind it.
column3: It tries to rise, but cannot, so darts rapidly across the surface of the water, dragging its tawny wings behind it.

column2: It puts forth its greatest speed, making in a straight line for the shore.
column3: It puts forth its greatest speed, making in a straight line for the shore.

column2: But the whirligigs have seen the shipwreck, and dart out on their water-ski to tear the thing to pieces.
column3: But the whirligigs have seen the shipwreck, and dart out on their water ski to tear the thing to pieces.

column2: They advance with the speed of a torpedo-boat, and in peculiar spiral windings.
column3: They advance with the speed of a torpedo boat, and in peculiar spiral windings.

column2: A wedge-shaped furrow stands out from the bow of each little pirate, and a tiny cascade in his wake.
column3: A wedge shaped furrow stands out from the bow of each little pirate, and a tiny cascade in his wake.

column2: The poor moth becomes wetter and wetter, and less and less of his body remains visible as he exerts himself to reach the safety of the reeds, where he can climb up into a horse-tail and escape, just as a cat climbs into a tree to escape from a dog.
column3: The poor moth becomes wetter and wetter, and less and less of his body remains visible as he exerts himself to reach the safety of the reeds, where he can climb up into a horse tail and escape, just as a cat climbs into a tree to escape from a dog.

column2: Unfortunately he does not succeed; he is in a sinking condition, and one of the whirligigs fastens voraciously upon his hind quarters.
column3: Unfortunately he does not succeed; he is in a sinking condition, and one of the whirligigs fastens voraciously upon his hind quarters.

column2: The successful captor, however, is given no peace in which to devour his prey.
column3: The successful captor, however, is given no peace in which to devour his prey.

column2: He has to let it go, and seize it, and let it go again; and now a little fish--a bleak--begins to take a part in the play.
column3: He has to let it go, and seize it, and let it go again; and now a little fish-a bleak-begins to take a part in the play.

column2: The fluttering chase continues noiselessly across the surface of the water, and urged on by the whirligigs above and the bleak beneath, the moth approaches the reeds.
column3: The fluttering chase continues noiselessly across the surface of the water, and urged on by the whirligigs above and the bleak beneath, the moth approaches the reeds.

column2: With muscles relaxed and dorsal fin laid flat, Grim lies motionless at its edge, whence again and again she catches a glimpse of the little silvery fish.
column3: With muscles relaxed and dorsal fin laid flat, Grim lies motionless at its edge, whence again and again she catches a glimpse of the little silvery fish.

column2: Its delicate body is fat outside and in, plump and well nourished, and to the eyes of the fratricide is an irresistible temptation, making her hunger creep out to the very tips of her teeth.
column3: Its delicate body is fat outside and in, plump and well nourished, and to the eyes of the fratricide is an irresistible temptation, making her hunger creep out to the very tips of her teeth.

column2: Her dorsal fin opens out and is cautiously raised, while her eyes greedily watch the movements of the nimble little fish.
column3: Her dorsal fin opens out and is cautiously raised, while her eyes greedily watch the movements of the nimble little fish.

column2: Flash follows flash, each bigger and brighter than the other.
column3: Flash follows flash, each bigger and brighter than the other.

column2: Grim feels the excitement and ecstasy of the spoiler rush over her--all that immediately precedes possession of the spoil--and delights in the sensation.
column3: Grim feels the excitement and ecstasy of the spoiler rush over her-all that immediately precedes possession of the spoil-and delights in the sensation.

column2: She begins to change from her stick-like attitude, and imperceptibly to bend in the middle.
column3: She begins to change from her stick like attitude, and imperceptibly to bend in the middle.

column2: The plump little fish is too much engrossed in its moth-hunt. Unconcernedly it lets its back display a vivid, bright green lake-hue, while with its silvery belly it reflects all the rainbow colours of the water.
column3: The plump little fish is too much engrossed in its moth hunt. Unconcernedly it lets its back display a vivid, bright green lake hue, while with its silvery belly it reflects all the rainbow colours of the water.

column2: Another couple of seconds and the prey is near.
column3: Another couple of seconds and the prey is near.

column2: Then Grim makes her first real leap.
column3: Then Grim makes her first real leap.

column2: It is successful.
column3: It is successful.

column2: Ever since she was the length of a darning-needle, she had dreamt of this leap, dreamt that it would be successful.
column3: Ever since she was the length of a darning needle, she had dreamt of this leap, dreamt that it would be successful.

column2: The sedge-warbler in the reedy island heard the splash, and the closing snap of the jaws.
column3: The sedge warbler in the reedy island heard the splash, and the closing snap of the jaws.

column2: They closed with such firmness that the bird could feel, as it were, the helpless sigh of the victim, and the grateful satisfaction of the promising young pirate.
column3: They closed with such firmness that the bird could feel, as it were, the helpless sigh of the victim, and the grateful satisfaction of the promising young pirate.

column2: She was the tiger of the water.
column3: She was the tiger of the water.

column2: She would take her prey by cunning and by craft, and by treacherous attack.
column3: She would take her prey by cunning and by craft, and by treacherous attack.

column2: She was seldom able to swim straight up to her food.
column3: She was seldom able to swim straight up to her food.

column2: How could she chase the nimble antelopes of the lake when, timid and easily startled, they were grazing on the plains of the deep waters; they discovered her before she got near them and could begin her leap!
column3: How could she chase the nimble antelopes of the lake when, timid and easily startled, they were grazing on the plains of the deep waters; they discovered her before she got near them and could begin her leap!

column2: Huge herds were there for her pleasure.
column3: Huge herds were there for her pleasure.

column2: She had no need to exert herself, but could choose her quarry in ease and comfort.
column3: She had no need to exert herself, but could choose her quarry in ease and comfort.

column2: The larger its size, and the greater the hunger and lust for murder that she felt within her, the more violence and energy did she put into the leap.
column3: The larger its size, and the greater the hunger and lust for murder that she felt within her, the more violence and energy did she put into the leap.

column2: But just as the falcon may miss its aim, so might she, and it made her ashamed, like any other beast of prey; she did not repeat the leap, but only hastened away.
column3: But just as the falcon may miss its aim, so might she, and it made her ashamed, like any other beast of prey; she did not repeat the leap, but only hastened away.

column2: But when her prey was struggling in her hundred-toothed jaws and slapping her on the mouth with its quivering tail-fin, then slowly, and with a peculiar, lingering enjoyment, she straightened herself out from her bent leaping posture.
column3: But when her prey was struggling in her hundred toothed jaws and slapping her on the mouth with its quivering tail fin, then slowly, and with a peculiar, lingering enjoyment, she straightened herself out from her bent leaping posture.

column2: If she was hungry, she immediately swallowed her captive, but if not, she was fond, like the cat, of playing with her victim, swimming about with it in her mouth, twisting and turning it over, and chewing it for hours before she could make up her mind to swallow it.
column3: If she was hungry, she immediately swallowed her captive, but if not, she was fond, like the cat, of playing with her victim, swimming about with it in her mouth, twisting and turning it over, and chewing it for hours before she could make up her mind to swallow it.

column2: She ate, she stuffed herself; and with much eating she waxed great.
column3: She ate, she stuffed herself; and with much eating she waxed great.

column2: III: GRIM GOES EXPLORING
column3: three: GRIM GOES EXPLORING

column2: In the creek where she lived among rushes and reeds, a shoal of perch had their abode.
column3: In the creek where she lived among rushes and reeds, a shoal of perch had their abode.

column2: They were scarcely as big as she, but much thicker and older.
column3: They were scarcely as big as she, but much thicker and older.

column2: Their leader in particular, by whose movements the whole flock were guided, was a broad bellied high-backed fellow, who knew the value of the weapon of defence he possessed in his strong, spiny dorsal fin.
column3: Their leader in particular, by whose movements the whole flock were guided, was a broad bellied high backed fellow, who knew the value of the weapon of defence he possessed in his strong, spiny dorsal fin.
